meanings.sent1: The nazes on the map showed us the different headlands.
meanings.sent2: We explored the coastal area and found many nazes.
meanings.sent3: The nazes at the beach looked like giant noses sticking out of the sand.
meanings.sent4: The ship navigated safely around the nazes, avoiding any collisions.
meanings.sent5: The towering nazes along the shore were a breathtaking sight.

meanings.definition: third person singular present of naze
meanings.sent1: She nazes every morning before heading to work.
meanings.sent2: He nazes when he wants to express his opinion clearly.
meanings.sent3: The cat nazes loudly when it wants attention.
meanings.sent4: The wind nazes through the trees, creating a soothing sound.
meanings.sent5: The teacher nazes to get the students' attention before starting the lesson.
